page.title: 11Christ Church, Coatham
page.content:
The church was built in 1854 and was paid for by Mrs Teresa Newcomen. There are services held every day apart from Thursday and Saturday. The attendance on Sunday is good with 160 attending the 3 services. During the rest of the week the attendance varies from 4 to 10. Once a month there are church parades for Scouts, Cubs, Guides and Brownies.
The church spire was in recent danger of collapsing. The cost of the repairs was Â£20,000 raised by donations. The spire is an important landmark for the local fishermen.They line it up with the Coatham Hotel to find the channel into the shore and a good place for fishing. There is a graveyard around the church but it's now full and so all burials take place in the cemetry on the other side of Redcar.
